posts.post_content:
"Ghave, guru of spores", plus "utopia mycon", plus "blade of the bloodcheif", and "parallel lives" equals Boom infant saps, mana and +1/+1 counters...equip ghave with blade, use a mana or a sap for mana getting a counter on ghave removing it to put two saprolings in play. Then sack two to get four and four for eight....rinse and repeat. Throw in the draw thallid and haist thallid and even if you wanna be mean deathspore thallid...I've only gotten it of three times...once in arch enemy me being the arch.  
Win sixth turn swinging with 10000000 10000000/10000000 saplings and a 9999999999/9999999999 ghave  
:):):):):):):):):): ;). They quit before I swing....more like when I said I go infinite....need to fix some things but fungus tribal never been so strong.

Posted By: Ouroborobelisk (11/25/2011 6:36:30 AM)
Rating:

@4wolf359

Actually, you can't. Summoning sickness. Life and Limb makes the saprolings into forests, yes, but they're still creatures, they still suffer from summoning sickness.

I'll admit, I did not like Ghave at first. I thought he was so much inferior to Karador that it wasn't even funny. Then I realized that with the way I have my deck set up, I need instant-speed sac engines, and Ghave actually delivers, AND provides some form of pump at the same time, which means some of my other creatures can hit harder. Ghave, alongside the other five sac'ers, allows my deck to get more creatures into my grave for the recursion effects to properly go off (as well as allow last-minute sac's to get Karador out for cheap on my turn).

posts.post_content: Pretty much my favorite commander. Heres some tech i've been running with great success in our casual multiplayer games. INN and DA have brought many goodies for ghave. [Mentor of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mentor of the Meek), [Mikaeus, the Lunarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mikaeus, the Lunarch) and insane lands like [Gavony Township](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gavony Township), [Grim Backwoods](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Backwoods)and even [Vault of the Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault of the Archangel). [Rings of Brighthearth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rings of Brighthearth) works with ghave but is mostly so good with other stuff you want to run anyway like any Ajani, Elspeth or Garruk you can fit in. Also stuff like [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine) and those land abilities are pretty cool to copy.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine) becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.
posts.html:
How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. Contagion Engine becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.

posts.post_content: Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Not saying going infinite is not doable just seems easier fetching a single card and abusing the synergy out of it than setting up a 3 card combo which is a tad fragile. [Ivy Lane Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Lane Denizen) means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss. My personal favorite is comboing with [Vhati il-Dal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vhati il-Dal) - they attack, you spam a 1/1 and make the attacking creature a toughness of 1 and just chump... not even just vhati and [Deathspore Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathspore Thallid). The trick with Ghave is not only to include cards that combo with it but make sure those cards can combo with each other.
posts.html:

Ivy Lane Denizen means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss.
